logo_css.title: Logo CSS
logo_css.description:
Modify the styles below to adjust your logo.

Logo CSS

The logo CSS stylesheet allows you to adjust the size, and space around your logo. We use em as sizing unit by default, because it is relative to the font-size, but you can also use px. You can use decimals in em values, for example 2.5em.

Font Size

If you are using a text-logo, you can change logo size by adjusting the font-size.

font-size: 2em;

Padding

Add space around your logo by applying padding.

padding: 1em 0;

* The 0 in the above indicates that we don't want padding on left- and right.

Margin Top

Add additional space above your logo with margin-top.

margin-top: 0em;

Width

If you are using an image-logo, you can use width to limit the size.

width: 300px;

TIP: Sidebar

When using sidebar layout, it is better to remove the padding and apply a margin.

padding: 0 0;
margin-top: 1em;

items.helpvalue: 各种全局设置

items.inlinetitle:
显示诊断

Diagnostics

This option is used to diagnose issues with X3, and for creation of certain files- and folders when X3 is run for the first time. Diagnostics should be disabled once the website is running properly and diagnostic results are satisfactory.

items.helpvalue: Menu Processing

items.inlinetitle:
手动刷新 *recommended

Manual Menu Refresh

With this setting is enabled, you need to click Refresh Menu from the panel menu every time you want to re-build your site main menu. The advantage of this procedure, is that pages get created much faster since the menu is cached.

* When disabled, site menu will get created automatically after any change from panel.

Why is this recommended?

Building the site menu can be a slow process because it requires looping through all pages, extracting data, and looping through images. While you are editing your site, you may make hundreds of minor changes that do not affect the main menu, so why re-build the menu each time? Use this feature to publish your site menu only when required.

When should I click 'Refresh Menu'?

You only need to refresh the site menu after you make changes that affect the main menu. This could be when you create a new page, change the label of a menu item, or make changes that apply directly to the menu. As a rule of thumb, it is a good idea to always refresh the menu after you are done making changes.

Is it safe to disable this feature?

Normally YES, but it depends on the depth of your content and the speed of your server. If your menu refresh process is slow, it would be a good idea to keep this feature enabled. If your menu refresh process is fast, you could easily disable this feature, although pages would get created slightly slower.

* Manual menu refresh does not affect output speed of already-cached pages.

简单的菜单 *blazing fast, limited

Simple Menu Mode

Simple menu mode will drastically speed up the creation time of your menu. Because of the limitations, this setting is normally unsuitable, but if you have thousands of pages and/or are hosted on a very slow server, it could be a beneficial compromise.

Why so fast?

In simple mode, the menu is created by simply reading the directory structure of your content. Instead of having to load page data for each menu item, it simply creates menu items based on folder names.

Limitations

Simple menu mode has several limitations:

  • Does not support mega menu.
  • Uses folder name instead of label from page settings.
  • Does not support special menu settings like links.

* Use this setting if you plan on having thousands of pages and don't require advanced menu behavior. This setting may be especially useful for the sidebar layout.

禁用菜单

Disable Menu

Use this setting to entirely disable your site menu.

Why would I do that?

Normally you won't. It could be useful if you want to entirely ignore the menu-building process until your pages are complete. In some rare cases, you may be creating a single-page website, where the menu is not required.

使用 X3 CDN [Core CSS and JS]

Use X3 CDN

Serve core X3 javascript- and CSS files from the X3 CDN service. Serving these critical files from a Content Delivery Network, ensures that they load ultra-fast, and are served from a location close to the visitor. This feature is strongly recommended, and should not be disabled unless you have very good reason to do so.

Preload Site Object

Preload Site Object

Preloads the entire website after initial page load, so that all successive pages display instantaneously. While this feature is enabled, you will need go to tools › Site to publish the siteobject each time you are done editing.

* Avoid this feature if your website is heavy, with loads of pages and images.

网页导航

Page Nav

This setting adds arrows controls on the sides of screen, which allows the visitor to navigate between sibling pages.

items.title:
CDN 网址 [If you are using a CDN service]

CDN Service URL

If you are using a 3rd party content delivery network service, you can add your CDN url here.

基本网址

Base URL

Add base URL here if you are using a redirect.

日期格式

Date Format

Decides how dates are formatted in your website. Examples:

timeago This is a special setting that creates "fuzzy" timestamps like Facebook uses, for examples "4 minutes ago" or "about 1 day ago".

jS F Y by example, converts to 15th April 2016

Y-m-d by example, converts to 2016-04-15

* Use the following characters to create a custom date format.

Type Character Description Example
DayjDay of the Month, No Leading Zeros1 - 31
DaydDay of the Month, 2 Digits, Leading Zeros01 - 31
DayDDay of the Week, First 3 LettersMon - Sun
Dayl (lowercase 'L')Day of the WeekSunday - Saturday
DayNNumeric Day of the Week1 (Monday) - 7 (Sunday)
DaywNumeric Day of the Week0 (Sunday) - 6 (Saturday)
DaySEnglish Suffix For Day of the Monthst, nd, rd or th
DayzDay of the Year0 - 365
WeekWNumeric Week of the Year (Weeks Start on Mon.)1 - 52
MonthMTextual Representation of a Month, Three LettersJan - Dec
MonthFFull Textual Representation of a MonthJanuary - December
MonthmNumeric Month, With Leading Zeros01 - 12
MonthnNumeric Month, Without Leading Zeros1 - 12
MonthtNumber of Days in the Given Month28 - 31
YearLWhether It's a Leap YearLeap Year: 1, Otherwise: 0
YearYNumeric Representation of a Year, 4 Digits1999, 2003, etc.
Yeary2 Digit Representation of a Year99, 03, etc.
TimeaLowercase Ante Meridiem & Post Meridiemam or pm
TimeAUppercase Ante Meridiem & Post MeridiemAM or PM
TimeBSwatch Internet Time000 - 999
Timeg12-Hour Format Without Leading Zeros1 - 12
TimeG24-Hour Format Without Leading Zeros0 - 23
Timeh12-Hour Format With Leading Zeros01 - 12
TimeH24-Hour Format With Leading Zeros00 - 23
TimeiMinutes With Leading Zeros00 - 59
TimesSeconds With Leading Zeros00 - 59
timeago,Y-m-d,jS F Y

items.helpvalue: Images

items.inlinetitle:
防止右键单击

Image Prevent Right-Click

Add basic protection for your images by preventing the browser context menu from displaying when user right-clicks an image.

items.title:
警报消息 [empty = no message]

Alert Message

Add a message that will appear when visitor tries to right-click an image to download it. * Recommended: Leave empty to silently disable right-click context menu without showing any alert message.

隐藏图像

Hide Images

By default, all file names that start with double __underscore, for example __file.jpg, are hidden from page galleries. This is convenient if you for example want to add images only used in your page content, or if you want to add images specifically for a plugin.

Options

Starting with __ *default
Hides all images that start with double __underscore, for example __file.jpg

Starting with _
Hides all images that start with single _underscore, for example _file.jpg

Don't hide
No images will be hidden.

items.inlinetitle:
启用 Sitemap.xml

Enable Sitemap.xml

Enable the sitemap.xml for your X3 website. Not many reasons to disable this, unless your server is incapable of creating the sitemap.xml, or you simply don't want it.

启用 Atom feed.xml

Enable Atom feed.xml

Enable the Atom feed.xml for your X3 website. This can be used by RSS readers to stay updated with your website.

items.helpvalue: 设置您的X3的网站样式. * Preview styles with your Styler.

items.inlinetitle:
显示 X3 样式

Show X3 Styler Panel

This setting toggles your X3 styler panel, which is used to view different combinations of skins, colors, layouts and fonts. You would normally keep this setting enabled while adjusting your website, and disable it once your website design is ready.

Enabled
The styler button can be found in the bottom right corner of your website, and allows you to open the X3 styler panel. You can also force the styler panel to automatically open by appending ?styler to your website url.

* Browser will remember the current state of your styler panel.

Disabled
The styler panel will be disabled and entirely inaccessible.

items.title: 布局

选择布局

Select Layout

Select the main layout for your X3 website.

* Preview all layouts from the styler interface.

固定顶部条菜单 Menu

Fixed Topbar

Use this option to fix the topbar-menu to top of screen on scroll.

Fixed

Attaches the menu to top of screen on scroll.

Fixed on scroll up

Attaches the menu to top of screen on scroll up. This is recommended, and will only show the fixed menu on scroll-up, which indicates the visitor may want to navigate.

* Fixed topbar settings only apply for the topbar layouts.

items.inlinetitle:
宽的顶部条

Wide Topbar

By default, the entire topbar section is limited within an 1140 px width. This makes sure the logo and menu remain within a functional viewing area also on large screens. Enable the wide setting if you for some reason want to stretch the topbar to 100% width of screen, regardless of screen size.

* When using wide, you should also apply the filled skin style.

items.title: 皮肤

选择皮肤

Select Skin

Select a skin for your X3 website. Skins are complex color schemes, which alongside fonts, sets the mood of your X3 website.

* Preview all skins from the styler interface.

基色 [empty = skin default]

Primary Color

The primary color sets a complimentary color to go with your skin, and is used for several page elements. The color you pick here should depend on which skin you have selected. Normally, you should select a relatively strong color.

If left blank, the specific skins default primary color will be used. You can apply any color name like darkorange, or use a hex-based color like #FFC000.

* We recommend using color names found in the skin selector from your styler interface.

导航背景

Navigation Background

Using filled navigation will set a soft background color behind the topbar, sidebar and footer. Use clear for a transparent background on these items.
字体

选择字体组合

Select Font Combo

Choose from a variety of font combinations, available to preview from the X3 Styler.

Source

You can edit the font source or completely replace it with your own custom string.

* Find temporary documentation here.

Disable Google Fonts

If you want to disable Google fonts, select the none value. Font will default to Helvetica Neue, and you can instead set your own font-family from custom CSS.
标志

items.inlinetitle: 启用

标志效果

Logo Effects

When enabled, your text-logo will animate on mouse hover, for a playful visual effect. You can include as many words as you like in the title, and each word will animate separately.

* The Interactive 3D logo-effect comes as is, and cannot easily be customized.

同步影响

Synchronize Logo Effects

With this setting enabled, all words in the title will synchronize to the same animation. This tends to make the resulting effect more visually composed. When this setting is disabled, all words in the title will animate separately, for a more random effect.

* This setting has no effect if your title contains only a single word.
* If you have more than two words in your logo, we recommend keeping this setting enabled.

items.helpvalue: Go to manage › custom › logo to upload your logo-image. Unless you are using SVG format, your logo image dimensions should be approximately twice the size as you want it to display, to make sure it looks good also on "retina" devices.

items.title:
标志图片alt 标题

Logo image alt title

The image alt attribute is a text-representation of your logo image. It will not display for the visitor, but it is often used by search engines.

You should include a short title that represents your website.

items.helpvalue: 弹出幻灯片
为X3弹出幻灯片设置，点击时出现的图像.

items.inlinetitle:
启用

Popup Enabled

If you disable the popup, clicking on an image will instead navigate the visitor to a separate image landing-page. This represents a less functional interface for browsing images.

过渡

Transitions

Includes an animated slide effect when navigating between images in the popup.

* Transitions do not apply for touch devices, where it is natural to instead swipe between images. Also, for technical reasons, the transition does not apply in the loop stitch between the last and first image.

历史

Popup History

Adds a #hashtag in the browser URL with the current image ID. This allows you to deep link to the image when directly sharing the URL.

分享按钮

Show Share Button

Show the share button, which allows visitors to share the image on social services.

* Services in the share button are inherited from the toolbar settings.

变焦按钮

Show Zoom Button

Show the zoom button, which allows the visitor to zoom the image to original size.

* The zoom button is only visible if the image can be scaled up without exceeding original dimensions.

items.title:
背景不透明度

Popup Background Opacity

Set the opacity of the black background that appears behind the popup.

items.helpvalue: 弹出字幕

items.inlinetitle:
显示字幕

Show Caption

Shows image caption at the bottom of the popup.

自动隐藏字幕

Autohide Caption

Autohide the image caption after a period of mouse inactivity. Disabling autohide will force the caption to always remain visible.

居中字幕

Center Caption

Center-aligns the caption. This looks elegant if you have relatively short captions. However, if your captions are long and/or you have multi-line descriptions, you should disable this feature.

items.title: 字幕字段
items.inlinetitle:
标题

Show title in caption

Include image title in the caption. If you have not set a specific caption for the image, the image name (without extension) will be used.

描述

Show description in caption

Include image description in the caption.

* Only applies if your image has been assigned a description.

日期

Show date in caption

Include image date in the caption.

* Image EXIF date will be used if available. Otherwise, server creation date will be used.

EXIF

Show EXIF in caption

Include image EXIF data in the caption. By default, the following EXIF values will display: ModelApertureFocal_lengthExposureISO

* EXIF only displays if your image has EXIF meta data available.

items.title: 项目

items.description:
添加、删除或更改工具栏项目.

Toolbar Items

The toolbar items are intended for social sharing, but can also be used for custom links or custom content opened in the X3 popup window. Select items to display, create new items, or change the order. You can set your own labels, colors and icons from Font-Awesome.

JSON Configuration

The items configuration is a JSON object, and must be syntactically correct. If you get a red warning in the left margin, it means there is something wrong and the config will be corrupted. Be sure to wrap all "keys" and "values" inside double-quotes, and all items (except the last), should be followed by a comma.

Item

"id" : "facebook"
ID is just an identifier for the item, and has no function except for some special built-in items like the main share button, email, comments and download. ID must always be populated.

"icon" : "facebook"
Select any icon to use from Font-Awesome.

"label" : "Share on Facebook"
The text to display on item mouse hover, in the overlay-popup and in the X3 popup.

"url" : "https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=%7B%7Burl%7D%7D"
URL for the item. Can be a social sharing endpoint, which requires using one or more of the sharing variables %7B%7Burl%7D%7D %7B%7Btext%7D%7D, or can be a plain link to another web page or a popup.

"color" : "#3b5998"
Set the color for the icon. This setting is not required for the default items already included, as they are hardcoded into the X3 stylesheet. Only use this for new links and services, or if you want to override a color.

"display" : "page|overlay|popup"
Optional setting to only show the item in one or more modes: page, overlay or popup. Useful for creating items that only display in specific modes. Ignore this setting, or leave empty if you want the item to display in all modes. You can add multiple items: for example display:'page|overlay' will the popup.

"target" : "window"
Sets the target for the item click. By default, target is set to 'window', which opens a plain browser popup window, necessary for sharing services. However, you can open custom links or even custom content directly in the beautiful native X3 popup window. Additionally, you can simply open links in _blank or _self browser window.

"content" : "<h2>Lorem Ipsum</h2><p>Pellentesque euismod.</p>"
Instead of assigning an URL, you can add content directly in the items content setting. This setting forces target:'popup', and will display the data from content directly in the popup window.

"popup_class" : "some-custom-class"
Custom wrapper class for the native X3 popup window when using target:'popup'. This is an advanced setting for those who want to assign a custom CSS class to style your own content inside the native X3 popup window.

Share URL Variables

If you are adding a new sharing service link, you will first need to locate the specific services endpoint. After slight modification, you can then add the sharing endpoint to your items URL setting.

{{url}} - url to current page
{{text}} - title of page
{{description}} - description of page
{{image_url}} - encoded image url
{{raw_image_url}} - raw image url
{{file_name_ext}} - file name with extension
{{file_name}} - file name without extension

For example, Twitter's sharing endpoint looks like this:
https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=TEXT_TO_TWEET&url=URL_TO_SHARE

Therefore, the URL to be added for the twitter item should look like this:
url:"https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text={{text}}&url={{url}}"

items.helpvalue: 页面默认
在这里您可以修改默认页面布局设置，否则将单独应用于每个页面。设置页面默认值的好处是，你不需要为每个页面应用设置，除非你特别想覆盖一些默认值.

items.title: 详情

items.helpvalue: 一些基本的默认页面设置.

items.title:
默认页面的标题 * 推荐 empty

Default Page Title

Add a default title that will apply for all pages until overridden from page settings. We recommend keeping this field empty, since it is bad practice to have duplicate titles for multiple pages. Instead, you should add unique titles for each page, unless the folder name contains a sufficient title.

* Title should contain a brief summary, maximum 60 characters.

默认页面描述 * 推荐留空

Default Page Description

Add a default description that will apply for all pages until overridden from page settings. We recommend keeping this field empty, since it is bad practice to have duplicate descriptions for multiple pages. Instead, you should add unique descriptions to each page.

* Descriptions should contain a brief summary, maximum 160 characters.

默认页面的日期

Default Page Date

Date is only used for pages where you are displaying the date in the page context, for example blog-like pages. Normally, you will set date specifically for each page where you want to display the date, so this is only a default fallback. If you leave default date empty, it will use the page 'updated' date, unless you set a date specifically for the page.

Format

Although you can add the date as you like, we recommend the standardized format YYYY-MM-DD, year-month-day in numerals. The date format may display differently in your website, depending on your settings in global settings › settings › Date Format.

默认的预览图像

Default Preview Image

Preview images may display in the context (for blog-like pages), and will always populate page the og:image meta tag used when sharing. Preview image is normally set directly from the page, or extracted from the page's gallery. This setting is just a default for pages that don't contain images, and where the preview image is not set specifically.

You need to include the relative file path from within your content folder to the image. For example 2.galleries/3.style/van.jpg.

默认体类 [tags]

Default Body Classes

Here you can add default body CSS classes for your page. You can add custom classes (if defined in your custom CSS), or native X3 body classes. For example no-headercustom-class

* Add items by typing them in order, and hitting enter/return or comma on keyboard

Important!

If you populate body classes specifically for a page, classes added here will NOT apply because this setting is only a default. If you want to INCLUDE body classes for each page, you should instead add them to the include › body setting.

menu-absolute,menu-absolute-20,menu-absolute-50,no-footer,no-pad,no-header,hide-toolbar
模块

items.helpvalue: 所有页面模块的默认设置（上下文、文件夹和画廊）.

items.title:
默认页面模块[tags]

Page Modules

This setting is used to set the default modules layout- and order of the page. Normally, you should keep the default settings here, and instead edit on a per-page basis if required.

* Add items by typing them in order, and hitting enter/return or comma on keyboard

Modules

There are three page modules:

context

The context module contains all page context, which may include title, description, date, amount and content.

folders

The folders module will display all subfolders (albums) of the current page. If the current page does not have subfolders, the module will not display.

gallery

The gallery module will display all images of the current page. If the current page does not have any images, the module will not display.

NB! folders module will only display on the page if the page contains subfolders, and gallery module will only display on page if the page contains images. Therefore, it is very unlikely that you will need to remove them.

Examples

By default, context will display first, followed by page folders, and gallery. Normally, you won't have both folders and images in the same page.contextfoldersgallery

In some cases, you may wish to switch the order of page modules. In the below example, gallery displays before the page context.gallerycontextfolders

If you remove the gallery module, it will not display in the page, even if the page has images.contextfolders

context,folders,gallery

items.inlinetitle:
包含 Disqus 评论

Include Disqus Comments

* Disqus comments only display if you have added Disqus #ID in your Account settings.

This setting enables Disqus comments on your pages. You can toggle this setting on a per-page basis, but here you can set the default switch.

items.title:
默认模块类 [tags]

Module Classes

Layout classes are CSS classes that can be applied to all modules in your page. You can add native X3 classes here, or custom CSS classes.

Example

separator add a horizontal rule below all modules (except the last), to clearly separate the modules visually.

more examples to follow ...

separator

默认的模块宽度

Module Width

This option sets the default layout width for all modules in the page. Normally, you will keep this option to default normal, and instead set width on either per-module basis or per-page basis.

NB! Layout width options are responsive, and are relative to the device screen width. For example on small mobile devices, this option has no effect, because the modules will scale down to device max width anyway. This option mainly affects desktop-sized screens, where the module content may need to be contained inside a functional viewing area.

Wide

The wide option sets the module to display at 100% screen width. It can be useful for many folders- and gallery layouts (especially slideshow), but should not be used for context.

Default

This is the default option, where the module is wrapped inside a default 1140 px maximum width. This ensures that module content remains within functional viewing areas also on very large screens.

Narrow

This option sets a relatively narrow layout, which is often suitable for context (text). Text content should be limited by width, because optimal human reading is limited to 50-80 characters per line (like a book).

Narrower

This option sets a narrower module layout, which is very functional for context (text). This is the default width for the context module.

Narrowest

This option sets a very narrow module layout, which is suitable for very specific content, for example a contact form.
上下文 [模块]

items.helpvalue:
页面的默认设置 上下文 模块.

Context Module

What is the page context module?

The context module is part of the page that displays the page details, including title, description and content. The context module will normally display at the top of the page, before any folders- and/or galleries.

In addition to the three default items, context can also include additional items labelamountfolders_amountdate and preview

items.title:
默认项目 [tags]

Default Context Items

This setting is used to set default items of the context module, and in which order they display. You will normally keep default settings here, and instead edit items on a per-page basis when required. The following items are available: titlelabelamountfolders_amountdatepreviewdescriptioncontent

* Add items by typing them in order, and hitting enter/return or comma on keyboard

Items

title displays the title of the page, normally included first.

label Instead of displaying the page title, you can use the label for shorter titles. This requires populating the label field for pages obviously.

amount displays the amount of images in the page gallery, useful for gallery pages. * Will not display if the page has no images.

folders_amount displays the amount of subfolders in the page. * Will not display if the page has no subfolders.

date displays the page date, useful for blog-like pages.

preview displays the page preview image, useful for blog-like pages when you want to display a related image below the title.

description Displays the page short description, normally included below the title.

content displays the main page content, normally included below title and description. * Content will only display if the page has content.

Examples

Default context items.titledescriptioncontent

Blog-like page with preview-image and date example.titledatedescriptionpreviewcontent

Alternative gallery-page, showing images-amount and excluding description.titleamount

title,label,amount,folders_amount,date,preview,description,content

默认宽度

Default Context Module Width

This option sets the default width for the context module. Normally, you will keep this option to the default narrower for context, as it keeps text-content within a functional reading-width.

NB! Layout width options are responsive, and are relative to the device screen width. For example on small mobile devices, this option has no effect, because the modules will scale down to device max width anyway. This option mainly affects desktop-sized screens, where the module content may need to be contained inside a functional viewing area.

Wide

The wide option sets the module to display at 100% screen width. It can be useful for many folders- and gallery layouts (especially slideshow), but should not be used for context.

Default

This is the default option, where the module is wrapped inside a default 1140 px maximum width. This ensures that module content remains within functional viewing areas also on very large screens.

Narrow

This option sets a relatively narrow layout, which is often suitable for context (text). Text content should be limited by width, because optimal human reading is limited to 50-80 characters per line (like a book).

Narrower

This option sets a narrower module layout, which is very functional for context (text). This is the default width for the context module.

Narrowest

This option sets a very narrow module layout, which is suitable for very specific content, for example a contact form.

默认类 [tags]

Default Context Classes

Context classes are CSS classes that can be applied specifically to the context module of your page. You can add native X3 classes or custom CSS classes.

* Add classes by typing them in order, and hitting enter/return or comma on keyboard

Important!

If you populate context classes specifically for a page, classes added here will NOT apply because this setting is only a default. If you want to INCLUDE context classes for each page, you should instead add them to the include › context setting.

Example

separator add a horizontal rule below the context module, to clearly separate it from the following module.

more examples to follow ...

separator

items.inlinetitle:

Folders Module

What is the page folders module?

The folders module is part of the page that shows page subfolders. This would often be used for an albums-overview or a blog-like page, in both cases listing child pages of the current page.

The folders module will normally display with preview images from the child folders, by default in a grid layout. However, there are numerous ways to change the layout and style of the folders listing module.

items.title:
默认布局

Default Folders Layout

Select a default layout for the folders page module. Although this can be set specifically for each page, you can set a default here.

Grid

Use the grid method to create robust grid layouts, which respond nicely to different screen widths.

Vertical

Simply list images vertically in a blog-like style. Functional, responsive and works nicely on all devices.

Justified

Use the justified method to create neat layouts with images of different aspects. Justified will scale images within rows to allow an elegant layout which the fills space available.

Columns

Use the columns method to create a vertical masonry-style layout which emphasizes portrait aspect images. Columns will scale images within columns to allow an elegant layout which fills space available.

Carousel

The carousel method displays multiple items in a horizontal carousel layout. The carousel is useful for teaser pages.

默认项目 [tags]

Default Folders Items

This setting is used to set default items of the folders module, and in which order they display. You will normally keep default settings here, and instead edit items on a per-page basis when required. The following items are available: titlelabeldateamountdescriptionpreview

* Add items by typing them in order, and hitting enter/return or comma on keyboard

Items

title displays the title of the folder/page, normally included first.

label Instead of displaying the page title, you can use the label for shorter titles. This requires populating the label field for pages naturally.

date displays the page date.

amount displays the amount of images in the page, if more than 0.

folders_amount displays the amount of folders in the page, if more than 0.

preview displays the page preview image.

description displays the page short description.

Examples

Default folders items.titledatedescriptionpreview

Display the folders preview image in layout without any text. Optionally add title instead using the caption overlay setting. preview

Folders listing without showing any images.titledatedescription

Display title below preview image, instead of above.previewtitle

title,label,date,amount,folders_amount,description,preview

默认宽度

Default Folders Module Width

This option sets the default width for the folders module.

NB! Layout width options are responsive, and are relative to the device screen width. For example on small mobile devices, this option has no effect, because the modules will scale down to device max width anyway. This option mainly affects desktop-sized screens, where the module content may need to be contained inside a functional viewing area.

Wide

The wide option sets the module to display at 100% screen width. This will effectively.

Default

This is the default option, where the module is wrapped inside a default 1140 px maximum width. This ensures that module content remains within functional viewing areas also on very large screens.

Narrow

This option sets a relatively narrow layout, which is often suitable for context (text). Text content should be limited by width, because optimal human reading is limited to 50-80 characters per line (like a book).

Narrower

This option sets a narrower module layout.

Narrowest

This option sets a very narrow module layout.

排序顺序

Sorting Order

Set the sorting order for page folders listing. By default, pages are listed in ascending order by number 1 - 9 or name A - Z.

标题大小

Title Size

Set a relative size for titles in the page folders module. Some layouts, like vertical, are suitable for large titles, while other layouts like grid may require smaller titles.

默认类[tags]

Default Folders Classes

Folders classes are CSS classes that can be applied specifically to the folders module of your page. You can add native X3 classes or custom CSS classes.

* Add classes by typing them in order, and hitting enter/return or comma on keyboard

Important!

If you populate folders classes specifically for a page, classes added here will NOT apply because this setting is only a default. If you want to INCLUDE folders classes for each page, you should instead add them to the include › folders setting.

Example

text-center Center-aligns text inside each folders items.

more examples to follow ...

frame,text-center,separator,hover,card

限制数目[0 = 没有限制]

Folders Display Limit

Use this setting to limit the amount of child folders displaying in the page. It is unlikely you will need this option by default, but it can be useful for specific pages. You may for example wish to display only the last 3 child folders for a blog-page or a specific albums-page.

Hide Folders

Use this setting to force-hide folders module from displaying in the page. PS! Folders layout will in any case only display if the page has child pages.

Split View

The split view setting allows you to split the folders listing into two columns, with preview-image on one side, and folder details (title, description etc) on the other. This setting works best with the vertical layout, but in a few rare cases, you could also use it with a 2-column grid.

Below is an example of a split view with the vertical layout.

Split View Ratio

The split view is based on a 12-column grid, and default ratio 6 means the columns will split into two equally-sized columns. If you increase the ratio, the left column will occupy more space. The ratio can be set from 1 to 12, to indicate how many columns the left side should occupy. Normally, you should be considering values between 4 and 8 for any functional layout.

* Example of ratio to set 4, which means left side will occupy 33.3% of the available width

Invert Split

By default, the split is inverted so that preview-image is on the left, and text is on the right. If you disable invert, the text will be on the left, and image on the right.

Crop Folders Images

This setting allows you to crop the preview images which display in the folders module. The advantage of cropped images, is that it provides a consistent layout because all images listed are the same size. If you don't enable crop, you can still use preview images, but they will display at original aspect ratios.

* It is strongly recommended to use crop for the grid layout

Aspect Ratio

Use the aspect ratio to decide the crop ratio of the image. For example 1:1 will display a symmetrical square image, 2:1 will display a wide image, while 1:2 will create a tall image. It all depends on your images, and the layout you are using.

图像字幕叠加

Folders Preview Image Caption

Enable preview image caption, which displays over the folders preview image. Useful for some layouts if you want to add details over the image, instead of above or below the image.

* This setting is particularly useful when using either the justified or columns layout, because having details overlay the image will not disrupt the layout.

Display a tooltip on preview mouse hover, which reveals additional details from the folders item. This feature is useful for cramped layouts, where you want to additional information about the page folder available on mouse hover.

竖向布局

Vertical Layout

The vertical method simply creates a layout where images are stacked vertically and respond to screen width. This layout is simple but effective for scrolling through items both on desktop- and small touchscreen devices. It is recommended to use the vertical layout with the narrow module width.

items.inlinetitle:
滚动导航

Scrollnav

Adds controls on the right side of the screen to elegantly scroll through images with mouse click or keyboard click.

横向规则

Horizontal Rule

Adds a subtle 1px horizontal rule between each folder item. An elegant way to clearly separate items.

items.helpvalue:
网格布局

Grid Layout

Use the grid method to create robust grid layouts, which can respond to different screen widths. Because it is a strict grid, unless your images are all the same aspect, you should use the crop setting to achieve a uniform layout.

items.title:
列 [large-, medium-, small- screen]

Grid Columns

* This setting only applies if use width is disabled.

Create a grid layout by defining the amount of columns available in the grid on large-, medium- and small screens respectively.

* Add items by typing them in order, and hitting enter/return or comma on keyboard

Examples

The default grid displays 3 columns on large screens, 2 columns on small screens and a single column on small (mobile) screens.321

Add more columns to create a thumbnails-like layout. In this example, we have 6 columns on large screens, 3 columns on medium screens, and 1 column on small screens. * We recommend a single column on small screens (mobile devices), because it simply works best.631

By omitting values for medium- and small screens, you can set an amount of columns that apply for all screen sizes. Keep in mind, when doing such, your grid will scale down to a large degree on small devices.3

items.inlinetitle:
使用宽度

Grid Use Width

There are two ways of using the grid layout.

Use Width Disabled

By default, use-width is disabled, and the grid-layout relies on the columns setting to define a columns layout.

Use Width Enabled

If use-width is enabled, grid columns will attempt to occupy the width defined in the column width setting. The amount of columns you get, will therefore depend on the target-width, and the width of the parent container.

items.title:
列宽 [px]

Column Width

* This setting only applies if use width is enabled.

Instead of defining the amount of columns, set a target-width for columns. The amount of columns created, will depend on the target-width and the available horizontal space. * When using Column-width, the layout is responsive by nature, because less columns at any specific width will fit in smaller screens.

网格空间[px, -1 for auto]

Grid Space

The amount of space in px between grid items.

items.helpvalue:
两端对齐布局

Justified Layout Settings

Use the justified method to create neat layouts with images of different aspects. Justified layout will scale images to fit within specified row target height, allowing elegant layouts that fill the available space. Justified layout works for both GALLERY and FOLDERS modules.

* Justified layout is not compatible with meta-data (title, description etc), unless you use captions-overlay or tooltip.

* The justified layout is responsive by nature, since images will fill each row at whatever width is available.

items.title:
行高 [px]

Target Row Height

Set a target row-height, where images will be scaled within. The larger the target-height, the larger the images are, but fewer images will fit inside each row.

* The justified layout will calculate height of each row based on target-height and the amount- and aspect of images inside. Sometimes, you may get an orphan-image on a separate row at the bottom.

空间 [px]

Space

Space in px between items in the justified layout.

items.inlinetitle:
在小型移动设备上禁用

Disable justified grid on small mobile devices

Since the justified grid often stacks images vertically on small mobile devices anyway, it may be unnecessary to process them in a justified layout. Furthermore, it is often easier for visitors on small mobile devices to simply scroll through images stacked vertically.

* Images will stack vertically on small mobile devices.
* Justified layout will still work on tablets 700px and up.
* This setting may be beneficial for galleries with several hundred images.

items.helpvalue:
列布局

Columns Layout

Use the columns method to create a vertical masonry-style layout which emphasizes portrait aspect images. This layout will scale images within the columns to allow an elegant layout which fills the space available.

items.inlinetitle:
使用宽度

Use Width

This setting allow you to set a target-width for columns in the columns layout. The value applied here decides the amount of columns that are able to fit into the width of the parent container. * We strongly recommend using this setting for the columns layout, because it allows a responsive layout with less columns on smaller devices.

items.title:
列的宽度 [px]

Column Width

* This setting only applies if use width is enabled.

Set a target-width for columns in the columns layout. The value applied here decides the amount of columns that are able to fit into the available width of the parent container.

列

Columns

* This setting only applies if use width is disabled.

Set the amount of columns to stack items within.

空间[px, -1 for auto]

Space

Space in px between items in the columns layout.

items.helpvalue:
轮播布局

Carousel Layout

The carousel method displays multiple items in a carousel-like layout, supporting swipe, keyboard and video.

items.title:
数量

Carousel Amount

Set the amount of carousel items to display simultaneously on screen.

items.inlinetitle:
使用高度

Carousel Use Height

This setting attempts to resize image based on height, so that they fit into the carousel without having to apply crop to the images for uniform sizes. * This setting is experimental. We recommend leaving disabled, and using carousel-amount with an image crop.

items.title:
目标高度 [px]

Carousel Target Height

* This setting only applies when use height is enabled.

Set a target height for images in the carousel.

空间 [px]

Carousel Space

Space in px between items in the carousel.

自动播放间隔 [milliseconds, 0 = autoplay disabled]

Carousel Interval

Set the carousel to autoplay, so it slides to next items after a specified interval (ms). The Interval value should be in milliseconds, so 3000 means 3 second intervals.

Set value to 0 to disable autoplay.

items.inlinetitle:
显示计时器

Carousel Show Timer

When in autoplay mode, shows an animated visual element representing the interval.

懒加载

Carousel Interval

Lazy-load images as they come into view, instead of preloading all images on page-load. This setting should be enable if you have dozens of images in your carousel. If there are only a few, you should perhaps disable for better loading performance.

背景

Carousel Background

Adds a subtle background behind the carousel, which helps it stand out. Useful if you are using large space between items.

显示导航

Carousel Show Nav

Show the carousel navigation items: arrows and dots. You would only disable this option if you have enabled autoplay.

显示标签

Show Tabs

When enabled, tab buttons will be created for each page in the carousel [see demo]. Although carousel with tabs has several limitations, it can be very useful to create an interactive timeline-effect for groups of pages.

Carousel Tabs Info

  • When tabs are enabled, carousel amount will always be set to 1, since tabs only support a single active item visible on screen.
  • Tabs should normally be used with the Split View folders setting as in the demo.
  • Tabs are populated by page label or page slug (folder name) if label is not set. Titles are not used because they are often too long and will display in the carousel anyway. Tab titles should be short and accurate.
  • Unless all your folder preview images are all the same aspect, you should use the Crop Preview Images setting (for example 3:2) to achieve a uniform carousel layout. If images are at different size, the carousel will scale to the size of the tallest image in the carousel, which will leave a lot of empty space.

循环

Carousel Loop

Stich the carousel at end-points, so that it seemingly loops.

Gallery Module

What is the page gallery module?

The gallery module is part of the page layout that displays the page's images. There are numerous layout-options and styles to choose from for the gallery module.

* The gallery module will only display in the page if the page has images uploaded.

Columns

Use the columns method to create a vertical masonry-style layout which emphasizes portrait aspect images. Columns will scale images within columns to allow an elegant layout which fills space available.

Carousel

The carousel method displays multiple items in a horizontal carousel layout. The carousel is useful for teaser pages.

Slideshow

The slideshow is a powerful gallery layout that supports swipe, keyboard nav, thumbnails, autoplay, fullscreen, video and more. The slideshow method comes with comprehensive settings to account for a variety of layout combinations.

Wide

Narrow

This option sets a relatively narrow layout, which is often suitable for context (text). Text content should be limited by width, because optimal human reading is limited to 50-80 characters per line (like a book).

Narrower

排序的图像

Sort Images by

Choose how to sort images in the page gallery.

Name
Sorts images by file name. This setting is normally sufficient if your images are named sequentially.

Title
Sorts images by image title. If image title is empty, file name will be used instead.

Date
Sorts images by date. This option uses the image's own EXIF date, which is normally from when the photo is taken. If there is no EXIF date, server-date will be used instead, which is normally from when the file is uploaded.

Shuffle
Shuffles the sorting order.

Custom
Sorts images by custom order, set from the gallery tab. Use direction ascending for custom sort, unless you want to invert your custom sorting.

Directon

Use ascending- or descending to set sort direction in combination with the above.

Ascending
Sorts images in ascending order. For names, this will be [0-9][A-Z]. For dates, this will be oldest first, newest last.

Descending
Sorts images in descending order. For names, this will be [Z-A][9-0]. For dates, this will be newest first, oldest last.

* Ascending/descending has no effect on shuffle.

标题大小

Title Size

Set a relative size for titles in the page gallery module. Some layouts, like vertical, are suitable for large titles, while other layouts like grid may require smaller titles.
